help.desc: Filter the sequences according to a length cut-off
Filter the sequences according to a frequency cut-off
Select the first position in the reference miRNA for the analysis of nt-substitution variants
Select the last position in the reference miRNA for the analysis of nt-substitution variants
Select the number of positions to consider in the trimming variants. The default value of 3 considers 3 positions upstream and 3 positions downstream of the reference 5'-end or 3'-end miRNA
Select the number of nucleotides to be considered in the 3' addition variants

Select all sequences mapped onto a miRNA-like database. In the case, the annotation was done usign SeqBuster Server, you can choose between: miRNA or misRNA (miRNA star) or the same name chosen when annotating with the stand-alone version.
Select the type of isomiRs to consider in the analysis: addition, 5' trimming, 3' trimming or nt-substitution
Select a cut-off value. This value is used to filter the isomiRs contributing in more than a specific percentage to the total of sequences annotated in the same miRNA locus
Select "Z-score" to apply a statistical method to exclude sequencing errors as the possible cause of the nucleotide modifications (Dohm et al., 2008, Nu Ac Res., 36 (16): e105)

This option calculate a p-value to highlight a significan bias in the type of the reference miRNA involved in the nt-substitution and the trimming variants; or the type of nucleotide being added in the 3' addition variants

Chose â€œvariability significance" to order the miRNAs according to the abundance of the isomiR with respect the corresponding reference miRNA or "frequency" to order the miRNAs according to the total frequency
In analyzing the nt-substitution variants, select "reference nt" ot "isomiR nt" to show the nucleotides present in the reference miRNA or in the isomiR, respectivily
